skill.name: wp-migrate
skill.description: WordPress site migration and deployment using wp-migrate.sh. Use when migrating WordPress sites, syncing databases, managing backups, testing migrations, debugging migration issues, or working with WordPress deployment workflows including Duplicator, Jetpack Backup, and Solid Backups archives. Also use for code modifications, testing, git workflows, PR creation, and release management for this project.
skill.summary: WordPress site migration and deployment using wp-migrate.sh. Use when migrating WordPress sites, syn...
skill.author: BWBama85

security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation-only project for WordPress migration. All 1073 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES - the scanner detected shell syntax in documentation code blocks and misinterpreted SHA256 checksum references. There is no executable code with security vulnerabilities. The skill provides documentation examples for legitimate WordPress migration workflows using wp-migrate.sh.

content.value_statement: This skill provides expertise for migrating WordPress sites between servers and importing backup archives from Duplicator, Jetpack Backup, and Solid Backups. It handles database synchronization, URL search-replace, and provides rollback capabilities for safe deployments.
actual_capabilities: Migrate WordPress sites between servers via SSH using rsync
Import backup archives from Duplicator, Jetpack Backup, and Solid Backups
Perform URL search-replace to align destination domains
Create automatic backups before migration with rollback support
limitations: Does not execute migrations - provides documentation and guidance only
Requires wp-cli, rsync, and SSH access to target servers
Does not modify source files - edits must be made in src/ directory
Push mode requires SSH access to both source and destination servers

use_cases.title: Deploy WordPress to production
use_cases.description: Sync staging to production with maintenance mode, backups, and automated URL replacement

use_cases.title: Import backup archives
use_cases.description: Extract and import Duplicator, Jetpack, or Solid Backups archives with table prefix alignment

use_cases.title: Rollback failed migrations
use_cases.description: Restore from automatic backups when migration issues occur with single command

prompt_templates.title: Basic Migration
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me migrate a WordPress site from staging to production using wp-migrate.sh. Source is local, destination is user@prod.example.com at /var/www/html.

prompt_templates.title: Archive Import
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a Duplicator backup archive at /backups/site.zip. Guide me through importing it to a new WordPress installation.

prompt_templates.title: Dry Run Preview
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me what would happen if I ran this migration by using --dry-run and --verbose flags. Explain the output.

prompt_templates.title: Rollback Recovery
prompt_templates.prompt: The migration failed. Help me use the --rollback flag to restore the site from the latest backup.

output_examples.input: How do I migrate from staging to production?
output: 3. Script handles: database export, rsync, URL search-replace, backup creation
3. Script auto-detects format, extracts, performs search-replace
4. Restores database and wp-content from backups

best_practices: Always run with --dry-run --verbose first to preview all operations
Use --yes flag for CI/CD pipelines to skip confirmation prompts
Test rollback procedures in a safe environment before production migrations
anti_patterns: Do not edit wp-migrate.sh directly - modify files in src/ directory
Do not skip backups - always let the script create timestamped backups
Do not run without verifying SSH connectivity and wp-cli availability first

faq.question: What backup formats are supported?
faq.answer: Duplicator ZIP archives, Jetpack Backup ZIP/TAR.GZ, and Solid Backups ZIP with automatic format detection.

faq.question: How does search-replace work?
faq.answer: The script detects source and destination URLs, then uses wp search-replace to update all references in the database.

faq.question: What is the stellarsites flag for?
faq.answer: It excludes managed hosting mu-plugins when migrating to StellarSites hosting to avoid permission issues.

faq.question: Does this support multisite?
faq.answer: Current version focuses on single-site WordPress installations. Multisite support is listed as a future enhancement.

faq.question: How do I customize rsync options?
What happens to destination plugins?
faq.answer: Use --preserve-dest-plugins flag to keep plugins/themes not present in source after migration completes.
